department: Foreign Affairs, Trade And Development (Department Of)
short_summary: Analysis of Canada's alignment with the Ceres2030 interventions for development programming in agriculture and food systems
description: Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) examines Canada’s alignment with Ceres2030 interventions through the creation of a customized machine learning model to understand and demonstrate increased programming. This model will extract characteristics, features, and details from project documents and outcomes presented in Management Summary Reports (MSR) to enhance details found in existing departmental reporting and DAC code databases.
full_summary:
### Advanced Contract Award Notice

**Notice ID**: 23-224572
**Publication Date**: August 12, 2022
**Closing Date and Time**: August 26, 2022 at 2:00 PM EDT
**Notice Status**: Expired
**Trade Agreements**: The procurement is subject to the following trade agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement (CColFTA), Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement (CHonFTA), Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement (CPanFTA), Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA), Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA), Canada-United Kingdom Trade Continuity Agreement (CUKTCA), Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), and World Trade Organization-Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-GPA).

### Background

Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (Department of) has a requirement for an in-depth analysis of Canada's alignment with the Ceres2030 interventions. The goal is to understand and demonstrate increased programming in high-impact areas over time. The project aims to use machine learning to extract project characteristics, features, and details at the output and activity level to enhance the details currently found in existing departmental reporting and DAC code databases.

### Scope of Work

The successful contractor will use machine learning to analyze Canada's agricultural and food development programming. The contractor must have extensive experience providing evidence-based policy design, management, monitoring, and evaluation support, as well as experience working within complex partnership models involving governmental and non-governmental collaborators.

### Justification for the Pre-Identified Supplier

The Ceres2030 partnership and the University of Notre Dame (UND) have led several workshops and engagements with the G7 donors to discuss and demonstrate the machine learning models developed to support this initiative. They possess subject matter expertise and depth of experience with the machine learning tool to respond to the stated requirements.

### Trade Agreements and Regions of Opportunity

This procurement is subject to applicable trade agreements. Suppliers who are interested in participating in the procurement process must have access to these trade agreements.

### Submission Instructions

Suppliers who consider themselves fully qualified and available to provide the goods, services, or construction services described in this notice may submit a statement of capabilities in writing to the contact person identified below on or before the closing
